data.title: Issue adding second root folder that is inside a VCS ignored path
data.body:
Given directories like:
- my-project
  - node-modules
    - my-library
      where node-modules is a VCS ignored path

I cannot easily create a workspace with my-project and my-library as root folders.

Here's what works:
I can open my-library in a window and then add another root folder: my-project

Here's what doesn't work:
I can't open my-project in a window and then add another root folder: my-library (because this just does nothing)

Atom: 0.187.0

data.title: Opening multiple root folders in a single window, from the command line
data.body:
It would be great if there were an option to open multiple root folders in a single window, from the command line.  Right now, it opens a separate window for each passed folder.

Atom: 0.187.0

data.title: Paragraphs selection misses nonempty lines
data.body:
rowRangeForParagraphAtBufferRow misses nonempty lines

From the comment "Right now, a paragraph is a block of text bounded by and empty line or a block of text that is not the same type (comments next to source code)."

But the code will not match lines which contain non-word characters such as punctuation.

https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/f7bb8aab9e33090cc8455cfdf045efe6257568d9/src/app/language-mode.coffee#L183

This means that blocks of code are incorrectly selected if there is for example a trailing bracket on its own line.

data.title: Can you add a keyboard shortcut for "Toggle Soft Wrap"
data.body: A keyboard shortcut for "Toggle Soft Wrap" would be extremely convenient

data.title: Batch service providers by package
data.body:
Depends on https://github.com/atom/service-hub/pull/4 being merged and a published in `service-hub@0.5.0`.

Refs atom/status-bar#63.

data.title: Enable multiple users
data.body:
Currently, it is not possible to use atom for multiple users on the same linux machine. The socket file '/tmp/atom.sock' belongs to the first user that starts atom.
With this small change, a socket file will be created for each user.

data.title: Use screen ranges to select above and below
data.body:
This fixes #5788 

As reported on the issue, Atom behaved inconsistently while adding selections (above or below) on lines made of tokens with a `screenDelta > bufferDelta` (e.g. tabs). The behavior was not compatible with Sublime Text, too, which handles the scenario like this:
- Selecting above or below works with what's visible on screen (thus, no mismatch between buffer length and screen length)
- Soft-wrapped lines are therefore included while selecting
- When a soft-wrapped line has indentation, skip it and select the first real character

This is the behavior I would expect in Atom as well and, hopefully, this PR includes everything that's needed to achieve it :fire: 

An additional pair of :eyes: is most welcome, but even if code-wise this looks good, I'd prefer to leave this open for a while so that the community has the chance to test-drive it.

Thank you! :bow: 

/cc: @benogle @izuzak @nathansobo @kevinsawicki

data.title: Refused to evaluate a string as JavaScript because 'unsafe-eval' is not an allowed source of script in the following Content Security Policy directive:
data.body:
This will happen if something calls createIterator in lodash as shown:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/874898/6633451/d5082a10-c99c-11e4-8601-0a3a22eec845.png)

In my case I am trying to run gaze https://www.npmjs.com/package/gaze (which in turn depends on lodash)

data.title: Do not force the installer's splash window above other programs
data.body:
I'd like to be able to continue working while Atom installs. It's currently blocking the center 1/6th of my display.

I'm currently trying to fix a VM in XenCenter using the remaining space to the right of the splash window, which has been there since before I started writing this comment.

Appreciate that Atom is cool, but it's not cool enough to prevent users doing anything else with their computers. (It's still there, btw).

data.title: location of path display changes when dragging tab to new window
data.body:
First of all, thanks to all developers; really enjoying Atom—especially now that soft wrap indent has been implemented!

I noticed that when I create a new window and drag an existing tab over to it the file path of the document displays in the status bar, whereas it usually displays in the title bar.  This becomes an issue when the window is narrow and a long path overlaps with the word count and other info in the status bar resulting in an unreadable mess.  This discrepancy is also reflected in the Window menu.  Furthermore, it would great to have the option to open a new or existing file in a new window (either in Preferences or with a similar function to split pane), instead of having to drag tabs to do so.

data.title: Adjust `DisplayBuffer#getVisibleRowRange` logic
data.body:
Supersedes and closes #4597

Thanks to @izuzak, @neojski and @nathansobo for reporting the issue, providing an alternative algorithm and bringing the issue forward: you are great guys! :clap: 

As usual, an additional pair of :eyes: is most welcome :bow:

data.title: Add published date to Atom.io
data.body:
It would be useful to have the last publish date presented in a package view on Atom.io. There are some packages out there that were really popular but haven't been updated in a long while. This would give some visibility that a package may potentially or definitely not work with your current install of Atom. 

This would be used for [this](https://github.com/atom/settings-view/issues/424) issue as well.

data.title: Update documentation to point to atom/docs
data.body: All these docs have been moved to the atom/docs repository, integrated into the Flight Manual.

data.title: activationCommands change and docs
data.body:
Apparently when activationEvents changed to activationCommands the value for the property changed from an array to an object.  The deprecation warning did not mention it, which is should. I had no idea why my activationCommands changes wouldn't work.  Nothing would activate.

And now these docs are wrong.  https://atom.io/docs/v0.187.0/creating-a-package#packagejson

data.title: The unloadPackage function is insufficient when updating already loaded packages.
data.body:
The unloadPackage function https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/src/package-manager.coffee#L366 is insufficient when updating packages that was loaded before the update.

When the package is loaded, nodejs module.require is called https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/src/package.coffee#L399 which caches the module for later use https://github.com/joyent/node/blob/master/lib/module.js#L307.
When the package is reloaded after update, the old cached module will be loaded instead, which might cause errors if the update contained incompatibilities with the previous version.

It would seem the unloadPackage function would have to somehow remove the cached module from nodejs or include a version number to avoid caching, however restarting atom and thereby clearing the cache is also a solution.

data.title: Uncaught Error: ENOENT, no such file or directory '/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/request/index.js'
data.body:
[Enter steps to reproduce below:]
1. Updated Atom via GUI (clicked "Restart and Update")
2. Clicked on Package Update notification icon
3. Updated 4 packages (clicked "Update" button individually per package)
4. Clicked the "Settings" button for the last package updated (remote-edit).
5. Error thrown

**Atom Version**: 0.186.0
**System**: Mac OS X 10.10.2
**Thrown From**: Atom Core

Looks like node module `request` is referenced, but not installed. Upgraded to `v0.187.0`, but no change... `node_modules/request` still does not exist.
### Stack Trace

Uncaught Error: ENOENT, no such file or directory '/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/request/index.js'

data.title: Window resizes to 1px wide sometimes - Usability Issue
data.body:
It is not consistently reproducible - happens randomly. I have first noticed in 0.186.0 build and seen in 0.187.0 build. I am using Ubuntu 14.04 LTS. 

Did some trial and error when this happens: 
- if i try to open another window from command line like another folder using `atom` the new window opens normally.
-  If try to quit it will close normally. 
-  If i reopen the folder whose window is like 1px wide it will open with same dimension 1px wide. 
  Uploading a screenshot.

![screenshot from 2015-03-11 17 09 30](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2712395/6595702/a17d2db6-c812-11e4-9e39-ea46fdbf7013.png)

I feel the user able to minimize window(or because of bug) to such small size is a usability issue as the 1px wide window is difficult to locate and causes confusion to user.

data.title: Destroy only containing folds on selection
data.body:
As reported by @nathansobo on #5858:

> I'm fine with leaving the optimization in, although extra bonus :christmas_tree: would be to only destroy folds containing a selection when the selection changes. I don't think selectAll should destroy anything. If you get inspired I would love to remove the optimization combined with that behavior change.

:fire:

Any feedback or suggestion is very welcome, as usual. Thank you! :bow: 

/cc: @izuzak

data.title: Check for updates not working from Win7 atom 0.182
data.body:
Windows 7 SP1 x64, Atom 0.182.0

The check for updates fails on one of my machines (even though I know 0.187 is available). The check eventually times out. On startup, the menu changes from "Checking for update" (disabled) to "Check for update" (enabled). If I manually select "Check for update" the check times out and shows the "No update available. Version 0.182.0 is the latest version." message dialog

Is there any kind of Fiddler magic I can provide to attempt to debug this issue?

Thanks.
